online.game
Class stackCell<FINALTYPE extends stackCell<FINALTYPE,COMPONENTTYPE>,COMPONENTTYPE extends online.game.chip>

java.lang.Object
  online.game.cell<FINALTYPE>
      online.game.stackCell<FINALTYPE,COMPONENTTYPE>
All Implemented Interfaces:
online.common.OnlineConstants
public abstract class stackCell<FINALTYPE extends stackCell<FINALTYPE,COMPONENTTYPE>,COMPONENTTYPE extends online.game.chip>
extends online.game.cell<FINALTYPE>

stackCell extends cell with a stack of chips. The stack size is expanded as necessary. Along either stackCell or chipCell should be the basis for the cells of the board and other repositories of game bits.

Author:
ddyer
See Also:
chipCell, cell

this method is typically wrapped by subclasses to encapsulate comparing the contents of cells.

copyFrom

public void copyFrom(FINALTYPE ot)
clone the dynamic state of the cell from a cell on another board, and copy the stack contents. It's assumed that the stack consists of immutable objects so the structure can be shared.

Specified by:
copyFrom in class online.game.cell<FINALTYPE extends stackCell<FINALTYPE,COMPONENTTYPE>>

stackBaseLevel

public int stackBaseLevel()
level of a stack considered to be the floor. Most stacks use 0, but some stacks start with a background tile at level 0, with movable chips starting at level 1. This is used to calculate stack height for drawStack "liftSteps" parameter, and also for the x-axis jog of stacks at multiples of 5 height.

Returns:
an integer

drawStack

public boolean drawStack(java.awt.Graphics gc,
                         online.common.HitPoint highlight,
                         int xpos,
                         int ypos,
                         online.game.commonCanvas canvas,
                         int liftSteps,
                         int SQUARESIZE,
                         double yscale,
                         java.lang.String label)
draw a stack of chips, and detect the mouse inside the stack.

Parameters:
gc - the graphics
highlight - the highlight which collects mouse hit info
xpos - the x position of the base of the stack
ypos - the y position of the base of the stack
canvas - the canvas to draw on
liftSteps - the number of lift steps
SQUARESIZE - the square size
yscale - the y scale for each lift step
label - a label or null
Returns:
true if any call to cell.drawChip(java.awt.Graphics, online.common.exCanvas, online.game.chip, int, int, int, java.lang.String) returned true. Effectively this should be if the mouse hit any chip in the stack.
